benchmark_details.name: DRAGON (Dynamic RAG Benchmark On News)
benchmark_details.overview: DRAGON is the first dynamic benchmark for evaluating RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems in Russian on a changing news corpora, addressing the need for standardized evaluation tools for RAG systems in the Russian language.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and dynamic benchmark for evaluating retrieval-augmented generation systems in Russian and support reproducible and community-driven research.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While the proposed benchmark provides a valuable framework for evaluating RAG systems, it relies on a specific domain (news) and currently only supports Russian language documents.

data.source: Regularly updated corpus of Russian news and public documents.
data.annotation: Automatically generated questions using a Knowledge Graph constructed from the corpus.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of retrieval and generation components against the ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better retrieval and generation capabilities of the RAG systems.
methodology.validation: The benchmark includes a validation portal for assessing submissions against private datasets.

targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark addresses potential biases in retrieval and generation processes.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Datasets included in the benchmark are sourced following strict privacy regulations and guidelines.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The framework is released under the MIT license.
